channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: @barttels2 Ditto! Hard to believe it's still possible, especially on Twitter :)

@barttels2 Also good, but I preferred Gioia's interview with Russ Roberts (who had his own episode on CwT, I now remember, but I guess it didn‚Äôt wow me enough to post). Note that Gioia CwT was a year ago. Some good guests since then, but the conversations themselves were‚Ä¶ meh.
@wiznews Kakav haos u glavi. Tu vi≈°e nema mozga, samo supa.

The essay Vinay refers to is horrifying to read, especially coming from an ethicist I was in grade school in ‚Äò90s Serbia. To say total economic embargo deeply scarred all of us is understating it, while doing diddly squat to bring down Milo≈°eviƒá These are new levels of stupidity https://t.co/PQtyY2EBiV
And here‚Äôs a nice tidbit for those comparing Russia to WW2 Germany https://t.co/E4v2GKR6L1

@thelongvoyageMD Ne bih rekao da je odgovor svuda bio jednako lo≈°. Novi Zeland i Japan na stranu, u veƒáini zemalja nije se lagalo o broju umrlih, nisu se zbrda-zdola ukidale mere zbog predizborne kampanje, nije se pozivalo na ≈°oping u Milano‚Ä¶ ≈°to je sve dovelo do nepovratnog gubitka poverenja.
After long last, an episode of Conversations with Tyler worth linking to: Lydia Davis on language, translations, short stories, thick books, and much more üìö https://t.co/QUIP6BMkIP

Sjajna konferencija @UjedinjeniRS o dve godine katastrofalnog voƒëenja odgovora na pandemiju. Postoji *jedna* stvar u kojoj je Srbija (ƒçini mi se, iz daljine) bila bolja od proseka: obrazovanje. Ostalo je serija lo≈°ih odluka, prikrivanja, oportunizma‚Ä¶ https://t.co/xUjIlQNnzf

The slowness of decision-makers at all levels to update their priors based on new data is one of the (many) highlights of the pandemic. In this way they are no different than someone off the street, maybe even worse https://t.co/tX8dgCR4hB
Edward Teller is a prime example that you can be a world-class physicist and also as dumb as a rock. Sagan, on the other hand, was well aware of the turkey problem üìö https://t.co/yTi1hAsuBQ
Sagan on the perceived benefits of not pursuing truth. He would‚Äôve gotten into so much trouble two years ago üìö https://t.co/Yyoi8U7Bar
Sagan on science and anti-science. This kind of language could get you into trouble nowadays. üìö https://t.co/9Hg5lCeKil

I was on the receiving end of NATO bombs in 1999 and I still think this is pure unadulterated whataboutist baloney. President Xi should've chosen his friends more wisely, and been more careful about their autocratic tendencies rubbing off on him. Good luck with that 3rd term! https://t.co/FSuxrXe3ZU
Indeed. The precautionary principle should still apply for any future pandemic, but the pessimist in me thinks covid has numbed us instead of sensitizing us to them. https://t.co/ls6VLFBQq2
Back to microblogging. Making blogs fun again! https://t.co/fp3yLr00GG
Prava misterija https://t.co/XIg0dttmi1 https://t.co/nitgdFgh7n
On the other hand, this view from Mt Vernon is worth preserving https://t.co/ppA0zGc9NB
American NIMBYism runs deep https://t.co/BsXnFsfMOj
Brilliant https://t.co/olqXa6jnkT
@barttels2 Twitter app to subscribe, App Store to cancel subscription

@barttels2 If you get Blue using the Twitter app on iOS as an in-app purchase it‚Äôs as easy to cancel as any Apple subscription. FYI: Top Articles is a list of most shared links from accounts you follow in the past x (up to 24) hours. So you get good content without having to doomscroll! https://t.co/67l9j0V2zB

The Top articles feature of Twitter Blue is well worth the price! Now if only there was a Twitter Blue+ that removed promoted tweets (or a way to get Top articles into 3rd party clients)‚Ä¶ https://t.co/aCuct5OOJd
@siracusa Alas, yes. @davewiner has it right https://t.co/nDeRlJUGS4

‚ÄúMost TV shows are not good. The key problems are that too much quality scripting is required, and that the incentives are to try to get the show extended for another season.‚Äù Mini-series FTW https://t.co/DphqCQVFT5
Reading The Demon-Haunted World, trying to figure out if Carl Sagan would be disappointed in us or knew what was coming, realizing the two aren‚Äôt mutually exclusive üìö https://t.co/h6tDS5PatC
@oncology_bg Gotcha. Don't have the full paper so I wasn't sure what their assumptions were.
